definition[0]: the part of a shirt, coat etc that fits around your neck, and is usually folded over
example[0]: He grabbed me by the collar.
example[1]: He loosened his collar and tie.
definition[1]: a narrow band of leather or plastic that is fastened around an animal’s neck
definition[2]: an object that someone wears around their neck to support it when it has been injured
definition[3]: a way of making sure that stocks you own do not lose money, even if their price goes down
definition[4]: a circular ring that goes round a pipe to make it stronger, especially where two pipes join together
definition[5]: a band of fur, feathers, or skin around an animal’s neck that is a different colour from the rest of the animal
definition[6]: to catch someone and hold them so that they cannot escape
example[2]: The police collared him less than 20 minutes after the robbery.
definition[7]: to find someone so that you can talk to them, especially when they would prefer to avoid you
example[3]: He collared her in the staff room at lunchtime and started telling her about his holiday plans.
